Man involved in 70 \u2018cash only\u2019.description: Muzaffarnagar: A man involved in over 70 cases of theft was finally arrested by Muzaffarnagar police on Thursday. Surprisingly, Ansaar Ahmed, 23, had no mention in police records as he operated alone and left without a trace. Besides, he targeted only cash and left other valuables of his victims untouched. According to police, Ahmed believed that forming a gang would have led to an easy arrest. On Sunday, he was caught while stealing Rs 62,000 cash from a seed store on Court Road. During the interrogation, Ahmed confessed to have been involved in 70 theft cases in Muzaffarnagar and adjoining districts. Police recovered Rs 62,000 cash which was stolen from the seed shop. According to superintendent of police Satpal Antil, “He has committed 12 thefts in Muzaffarnagar and 60 thefts in the Meerut zone. He operates alone and has no other associate because he feels if he forms a gang, there would be no privacy. A police team has been sent to his home to recover other stolen goods and cash.” Five police teams were formed to solve the theft in the pesticide shop. After receiving a tip-off, a police team from Civil Lines police station arrested him from a bus stop on Thursday. The SP also claimed to have solved the case of loot at lawyer Urmila Sharma’s house which took place on June 3. Police arrested three culprits and recovered Rs 3.5 lakh from them. Criminal with 25k bounty killed in encou.description: MEERUT: A criminal, Adnan alias Moosa, wanted in several cases of loot and robbery was shot and killed by Saharanpur police in an encounter that took place between local police and motorcycle-borne men in an area under Rampur Maniharan police station. Moosa’s brother was injured. Saharanpur said Moosa was shot at and later succumbed to injuries. His brother, Nauman, sustained bullet injuries and was taken to a local hospital for medical aid. According to police the duo was on a motorcycle when they were hailed to stop during a surprise inspection. Instead they opened fire at the police who retaliated. In the shootout, Moosa and his brother were hit. Moosa carried a reward of Rs 25,000 on his head. Countrymade pistol was seized from the spot. The encounter took place days after a Muzaffarnagar-based criminal, Shahzad, was gunned down by Saharanpur in an encounter of May 26. Encounters remain unabated in the state despite criticism from human right bodies. At least 80 criminals have been killed in the encounter since the BJP government led by CM Yogi Adityanath came to power in March 2017. Meanwhile, in Noida, a criminal, Mannan alias Rashid, was held in a joint operation by SWAT team of Bareilly and Noida police on Sunday in an encounter at Dadri. Mannan sustained two bullet injuries and is being treated in a local hospital. He was wanted in over a dozen cases of loot and robbery. His name had come up in the sensational Rs 65-lakh loot in Noida's Jarcha area on May 27 last month. Existing bounty of Rs 50,000 was raised to Rs 1 lakh by Meerut zone ADG, Prashant Kumar, on June 7. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

In UP, woman throws hot oil on ex-lover.description: MEERUT: In a case of relationship gone horribly wrong, a 20-year-old woman threw hot mustard oil on a 22-year-old, just hours before the latter’s wedding day. The woman is a resident of Mazargate in Bulandshahr’s Anoopshahr area while the 22-year-old has been identified as Umesh Joshi. The bizarre incident took place on Sunday morning, hours before Joshi’s wedding. Joshi has sustained burn injuries on his face. According to police, the accused, who is now under arrest, confessed to have committed the crime after she learnt about her lover’s wedding with some other person. The woman sneaked into Joshi’s house at around 4 am and caught him off-guard. Joshi was fast asleep and couldn’t thwart her move. The accused has been arrested now, the police said. Basanti, the victim’s mother, claimed that the accused woman wanted to disrupt the wedding after he failed to “force her way in marrying the victim”. Joshi was discharged after given primary aid at a local hospital. He has sustained burn injuries on his face, but is currently stable. Sources claim that the marriage will continue as scheduled. Initially, a case of acid attack under section 326 A (voluntarily causing grievous hurt by use of acid) of the Indian Penal Code was registered at Anoopshahr police station. But later, the police stated that they would take remand under section 327. “The accused is under arrest. During investigation, it was established that the substance was hot mustard oil and not acid. Hence, the police will take remand under section 327 (voluntarily causing grievous hurt by dangerous weapon/means),” said Atul Kumar Chaubey, Annopshahr CO. BJP List 2019 Karnataka.description: BENGALURU: The BJP on Thursday released its first list of 21 candidates from Karnataka, but it does not include the names of sitting MP Karadi Sanganna (Koppal) or late Union minister HN Ananth Kumar’s wife Tejaswini, who is widely tipped to be the candidate from Bengaluru South. The list names the 14 other sitting MPs, including Shobha Karandlaje (Udupi-Chikkamagalur) and Suresh Angadi (Belagavi) despite stiff opposition within the party and anti-incumbency against the two. Party leaders said they are baffled by the exclusion of Tejaswini’s name and are unaware of the reasons for her candidature being withheld. “We inaugurated her personal office on Thursday and were sure of her name being announced,” one leader said. Rumours — from “technical” errors to the possibility that her name would lead to comments on “dynasty politics” — are doing the rounds. Sanganna’s candidature was withheld as the BJP is waiting for the JD(S)-Congress coalition to name its candidate. With the possibility of former chief minister Siddaramaiah contesting, the BJP will require a stronger candidate. The party also decided not to announce its candidate for Mandya, but two Congress rebels — A Manju from Hassan and Umesh Jadhav from Kalaburagi — have been given tickets. BSY has his wayThe first list confirms that the BJP central leadership continues to repose faith in state party president and Lingayat strongman BS Yeddyurappa. The list features names of his son BY Raghavendra and several confidants. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

AP BJP List 2019.description: NEW DELHI: The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP), on Thursday, announced its first candidate list for the Lok Sabha elections 2019 that includes 184 candidates. The party has named two candidates from Andhra Pradesh in the first list. Kanna Lakshminarayana will contest from Narasaraopet Lok Sabha constituency while D Purandeshwari will contest from the Visakhapatnam seat. Andhra Pradesh will go to polls in a single phase on April 11. BJP's Lok Sabha first full list The Lok Sabha elections will be held in seven phases from April 11 to May 19, 2019. The counting of the votes has been scheduled for May 23. The first phase will be held on April 11, second on April 18, third on April 23 and fourth on April 29, fifth on May 6, sixth on May 12 and seventh phase on May 19. Prime Minister Narendra Modi will contest from Varanasi constituency, while BJP president Amit Shah will fight from Gandhinagar in place of L K Advani. As many as 90 crore electors, including 1.59 crore new voters aged 18-19 years, are registered to vote in the upcoming general election. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Tejasvi Surya.description: BENGALURU: From a boy who was groomed by late Union minister H N Ananth Kumar and Tejaswini Ananth Kumar to becoming the challenge to the family’s control over Bengaluru South segment, Tejasvi Surya has come a long way.While expressing his gratitude to Kumar and his family, Surya says he is a stark example of the BJP’s intent to infuse young and new blood. You were a surprise choice for Bengaluru South. Did you expect this development?While I had feelers that there was something like this going around, I was quite happily savouring pani puri with my friends. To be honest I was overwhelmed and started tweeting about this. I only feel gratitude towards the party, which is facing a crucial election and has decided to take risk by fielding a youngster in such a prestigious seat. At 28, will you be able to fill the shoes of Kumar?Filling the shoes of Ananth Kumar is a far fetched thing for he was so gigantic. I only pray to God to give me strength, sincerity and earnestness to honestly work for the people of this constituency so that one day in the eyes of the people I can match up to Kumar’s contribution to the constituency. On lack of political experience, I have a well oiled party organisational machinery to support me with senior leaders there to hand hold me. So what is this election going to be for you?Primarily it is an election for PM Narendra Modi’s aspirational India. It is about the promise of a new and young India and I am just an ambassador of the message of this new India. It is a reflection of party and Modi’s inclination of bringing in young blood. Tejaswini not getting the ticket is quite sensitive...Yes it is sensitive but even during her talk with the Karyakartas she told them that the it was time to show maturity. She has given her full support to me. But what is your personal opinion about Tejaswini missing the ticket?When her name was first finalised by the state leadership, it must be March 11, I was the first to extend my support to her and remember posting on social media that she was the most deserving candidate and a good choice from the constituency. But the party decided to field an ordinary karyakarta like me. It is a decision taken by big people and I am just a foot soldier obeying their diktat. I have always supported Tejaswini ma’am and was literally groomed by that family. I have no reason for acrimony. Statements by Karti Chidamabaram suggest that you are the Schutzstaffel of BJP, or the infamous SS of the Nazi Germany... Your tweets also suggest that your idealogical beliefs are in conflict with the “Sab Ka Saath Sab Ka Vikas” For Karti Chidambaram and others I will reply back to them in their own coin. The idealogical inclinations are not an issue for this election. The issue for the election today, is PM Modi’s promise of a new and superpower India. My only concern as on today is to ensure that Bangalore South elects the BJP with a massive margin so that we will strengthen Modi hands. Rest is immaterial. Is age an advantage or do you require time to project yourself as a leader?That the party leadership has reposed faith in me speaks for itself and the least minimum I can do is to live up to it and say I am capable enough as on today to take on these challenges. You must rise to the occasion and I will rise to it. On dynasty politics, considering you are a nephew of a sitting BJP MLA and PM Modi has gone on the offensive against the Congress on the issue of “Naamdar”...My candidature and my role and activity in politics has no connection to my uncle’s political life. I have an identity of my own and have worked very hard over years. My aspirations precedes his elections. If the party leadership thought I was a rise to another dynast, they would not have considered me at all. In Video:BJP announces 28-year-old Tejasvi Surya for Bengaluru South seatDownload The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

2,200 dairy owners protest eviction move.description: MEERUT: With the district administration planning to move dairies out of the city area based on a directive of the Allahabad high court, 2,200 dairy owners took to the streets on Tuesday to protest against the move. The standoff continued for over an hour after which the officials agreed to give time to the owners so that they can move the dairies on their own. The move is despite the fact that the district administration has not been able to find suitable land on city outskirts. The matter has been pending for the past 20 years. In 1998, the Allahabad high court had ordered shifting the dairies out of city limits. However, the order was not complied with. In May this year, the court directed the district authorities to provide land to dairy owners and shift them. Lokesh Khurana, the petitioner, said, “The order has been there for over 20 years now. Despite this, the authorities have not taken any action in the matter. The same instructions to shift the dairies outside the city were given by the Allahabad HC to Varanasi too. While a cattle colony has been set up in Varanasi, which is PM’s constituency, the instructions are not being followed at all in Meerut.” The HC order dated January 4, 2019, read, “The municipal corporation Varanasi as well as Meerut shall identify all the unauthorised dairies operating in the towns concerned. Such list shall be forwarded to the district magistrates of the town concerned and the district magistrates shall initiate necessary penal proceedings against such dairies under relevant rules and norms for their violation. They should also make a complete plan for shifting the dairies outside the municipal area within a period of two months from now and forward the same to the state government.” The dairy owners protested against the decision of the district administration to begin the drive to move dairies. Meerut district magistrate Anil Dhingra said, “According to the HC order, the dairies have to be moved to the outskirts of the city. Providing a land for cattle colony is not a pre-condition. Since we are facing a deadline of June 30, there is little we can do than to follow the order. The dairy owners have agreed to move their dairies out of the city by Wednesday, failing which the administration along with the police will remove it.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

UP govt doctors wear black band in solid.description: LUCKNOW: Government doctors across Uttar Pradesh on Friday wore black bands to express solidarity with their counterparts protesting violence against two of their colleagues in West Bengal. The step was taken in response to a call for a four-day nationwide protest by Indian Medical Association (IMA) on Friday. Dr Amit Singh, general secretary of Provincial Medical Services Association, UP, said, “Government doctors wore black bands while discharging their duties at various hospitals in the state. In the afternoon, a delegation of the doctors submitted a memorandum addressed to the Prime Minister through the district magistrate." In the memorandum, “We have demanded security for doctors so that they do not feel scared” while discharging their duties. He added that more than 18,700 doctors who are members of the Provincial Medical Services Association, UP took part in the protest. Junior doctors in West Bengal are on a strike since Tuesday after two of their colleagues were attacked by a mob and seriously injured at NRS Medical College and Hospital in Kolkata following the death of a 75-year-old patient who died of a cardiac arrest. The incident raised concerns regarding security of doctors. In Meerut, doctors under the banner of Indian Medical Association, wore helmets and black badges in protest and demanded proper security for doctors so that they can work properly. “We condemn the incident and it is just sad that doctors who save people’s lives are being attacked. We need a safe and secure environment to function, or else we will not be able to admit any serious patients. This is because if there is a high probability of death of a person, the chances are that his family will be annoyed and might attack us,” said Dr Shishir Jain, president, Meerut Indian Medical Association (IMA) unit. As a mark of protest, doctors in Meerut wore helmets and black badges while they tended to their patients on Friday. “If our demands of providing adequate security to doctors are not met, then the doctors will go on strike. However, due to the protest, only common man suffers,” said Dr Jain, who condemned the incident and demanded strict action against the perpetrators of this heinous crime. Dr Raghvendra Sharma, vice-president of IMA's Bareilly unit, said “More than 25 doctors gathered on Friday and donned black ribbons on their arm. We have sent a mail to the Prime Minister's Office to condemn the Kolkata incident." In Pilibhit, a delegation of doctors associated with the IMA demanded constitution of a district-level committee comprising a senior police officer not below the rank of additional superintendent of police, the chief medical officer and a designated delegate of IMA to ensure safe working environment for medical professionals. The delegation was called for empowering this committee to review all cases of violence against doctors and enforce prompt legal action against the assailants. The delegation handed over a memorandum of demands to additional district magistrate, (finance and revenue), Atul Singh, which was addressed to the Prime Minister. “We have demanded a new legislation from the Prime Minister to protect doctors and their medical establishments from violence as everyone in the country has the right to work in a safe environment,” said Dr Deepak Kumar Gangwar, district general secretary of IMA in Pilibhit. OP Yadav, IMA secretary for Agra district said, “In solidarity with our colleagues in West Bengal, doctors wore a black ribbon on their arm and gathered at the district collectorate to handover a memorandum to the district magistrate and senior superintendent of police. They demanded adequate arrangement for strict implementation of the UP Medical Protection Act. Violence in hospitals adversely affects patient care and institutions will be reluctant to take up complicated and risky patients which will affect critical care. A national law against violence in hospitals has to be brought in urgently that should provide a minimum of seven years of imprisonment for hospital violence.” (With inputs from Ishita Bhatia from Meerut, Priyangi Agarwal from Bareilly, Keshav Agrawal from Pilibhit and Deepak Lavania from Agra) Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Chandrababu Naidu.description: KURNOOL: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday launched a blistering attack on Andhra Pradesh chief minister and erstwhile ally N Chandrababu Naidu, calling him 'u-turn Babu', whose "intent" was not on state's development. Addressing a well-attended election rally here, he sought to reject Naidu's repeated attacks that his government neglected the state. Andhra Pradesh goes to siumultaneous elections to the 175-member assembly and 25 Lok Sabha seats in the first phase on April 11 with the BJP contesting them alone. Listing various initiatives taken by the NDA government for Andhra Pradesh, Modi said it was during his regime that the Vizag-Chennai industrial corridor was flagged off and approval for the first National Institute of Ocean Technology (NIOT) given. It was also the 'chowkidar' who cleared the first Indian Institute of Packaging (IIP) besides approving the greenfield petrochemical complex for the state, he said. "Five years ago, your one vote made me PM. Your Pradhan sewak worked selflessly day and night for the people of the country. Chowkidar kept the interest of the state in mind," he said. Modi also recalled that the NDA government sanctioned first central university in Anantpur. He accused Naidu, the Telugu Desam Party supremo, of pasting state government 'stickers' on the Central schemes. "For sure, I could have done more work. I just required the cooperation of the state government. I made all efforts from my side, but the person who is running the government (Naidu), his intention is not Andhra Pradesh's development," Modi said. Levelling charges of corruption and dynasty politics against Naidu, he said the election date of April 11 will usher in the "double engine" of the state's growth -- a BJP government both at the Centre and the state. There was debate going on in AP that there were 'schemes for corruption,' ranging from the creation of the new capital Amravati, the Prime Minister charged. "The people of Andhra Pradhesh know whose coffers are being filled.. when this chowkidar sought accounts, u-turn Babu took a u-turn from AP's growth and walked out from NDA," Modi lashed out. Naidu had snapped ties with the NDA in March last year, accusing the Centre of not honouring the "promised" special category status to Andhra Pradesh. Hitting out at the TDP supremo for getting close to the Congress, Modi said Naidu has "found friends who are on bail," apparently referring to Congress leaders Rahul Gandhi and Sonia Gandhi who are on bail in the National Herald case. Modi, who had in the past hit out at Naidu for alleged family politics, said the election should also see the "son set", and called for a new "sun rise." He deliberately stressed on the "son" part to drive home his point on dynasty politics targeting the AP chief minister and his son and state minister Nara Lokesh. Without elaborating, Modi mocked that Pakistan has now accepted Naidu's "friends" as "hero." Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Now, Kisan Pathshalas to teach organic f.description: BIJNOR: To encourage organic farming among farmers in Uttar Pradesh, Kisan Pathshalas, known as ‘The Million Farmers’ Schools’, have been launched in the state. The schools aim is to encourage farmers to adopt eco-friendly organic farming and improve the technical know-how of those who have already taken it up. By switching to organic farming, it is hoped, farmers will shift from dependency on pesticides and other chemicals that have robbed the soil of its nutrients and lend a hand in recharging groundwater at the same time. The lectures are being conducted by the agriculture department officials and scientists with examples of farmers who have taken to organic farming and become market leaders by selling organic crops besides motivating thousands of others to follow their footsteps. Some like Bulandshahar-based farmer Bharat Bhushan Tyagi and Ram Saran Verma of Barabanki have also been awarded the Padma Shri. Addressing one such school in Bijnor, deputy director of agriculture department JP Chaudhary said, “In the world only 1.2% organic farming is being practised in the total area under cultivation. Therefore, there is a big market for organic products all over the world. Farmers can earn hefty profits through this method and also reduce cost of production.” He added, “There are 2.33 crore farmers in UP. Around 92% of them are small farmers. They can survive only on a multi-crop system. Besides they should set up poultry farms, pig and fish farming and raise cattle to increase their income. The government has set a target of doubling farmers’ income by 2022.” At the ground level, the cen tral government is providing a soil health card (SHC) to farmers in order to promote soil test to ensure balanced use of fertilizers to enhance yield. The test reveals actual quality of the soil and the ideal conditions needed. It is here that experts through The Million Farmers’ Schools advise the farmers which nutrients are required to improve soil fertility by adopting simple methods of recycling crop waste instead of burning stubble. They can take up composting and vermiculture (using earthworms) for preparing bio-fertilizers and also use farm products for making bio-pesticides. Water management is another vital issue for both farmers and environmentalists in view of depletion of water, especially groundwater. According to experts, in India, 85% of sweet water is used for agriculture and 15% for drinking. Most of the water is drawn from underground sources in UP, especially western parts, resulting in depletion of water tables. At many places, rivers have started to dry up and other water bodies like dried up ponds have been encroached upon. It is here that farmers can play a key role in reviving water bodies. It is estimated that half an acre of pond can recharge around 70,000 cubic meter groundwater. Right form of cropping is also essential for farmers who tend to mix and match different varieties of crops like cereals, vegetables and fruit in order to get two or three crops yields a year. Here, too, farmers are being informed how to go about it and make a profit as well. Last but not the least is the farmer himself — his good health too is important for good farming. That requires a balanced diet which he can source from his own kitchen garden than going to the market, say the experts. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

11-year-old girl raped in Meerut madrass.description: MEERUT: Days after a minor girl was raped and murdered in Meerut's Kharkhauda area, another 11-year-old girl was raped by a local maulvi inside a madrassa in Meerut's Khedi village under Saroorpur police station. According to police, the crime was committed on Saturday night but the family approached local police on Monday following which an FIR under section 376 (rape) of the Indian Penal Code and relevant sections of the Protection of Children from Sexual Offences (POCSO) Act was registered.  "According to the survivor, she was assaulted inside a local madrassa in the village. Investigation began after registration of the FIR and a cleric named Shahid was arrested on Monday evening," SP (rural) Avinash Pandey said. Earlier in Meerut, a 9-year-old girl was abducted, raped, murdered and her body was dumped in a sewer on June 6. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Raj Ghat gardener beaten to death in Bag.description: Meerut: A 50-year-old man who worked as a gardener at Raj Ghat, the memorial dedicated to Mahatma Gandhi in Delhi, was beaten to death for alleged theft in Baghpat late on Wednesday night. While the FIR filed by his family says that the victim, Begraj, was beaten up by some people who thought he committed theft at a house in Katha village of Baghpat, police sources say that his illicit relation with a local woman was also being investigated.“Begraj was returning from Delhi and was on way to his village Khekhda on Wednesday night. When he was in Baghpat town, he got a call after which instead of going to his house in Khekda village, he went to Katha. At 2 am on Thursday, a local UP 100 police van got a call that that a man was beaten up brutally allegedly for theft. When the police reached there, they found him lying in a pool of blood,” said Baghpat additional SP Ranvijay Singh.Begraj was rushed to a nearby hospital, where he was declared brought dead. “An FIR has been filed against six men, out of which two have been arrested. These men include the one who informed the police about his location. Investigation is on and the body has been sent for post mortem to get a clear picture,” said Singh.Police sources also said a love angle is also being investigated as the man allegedly had an illicit relation with a woman in Khekhda. "Her family allegedly thrashed him to death," they claimed. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Mamata Banerjee.description: VISAKHAPATNAM: Projecting TDP supremo and AP chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu as a “national leader of importance” and keeping the debate on the alternate front prospects in the ensuing elections alive, West Bengal chief minister and Trinamool Congress chief Mamata Banerjee appealed to people of AP to elect TDP again to keep the duo of Narendra Modi and Amit Shah away from power. “Who is Modi to ask about our Prime Minister candidate? We will decide who to elect our leader as there will be alternative for Modi,” she pointed out. Mamata said Naidu has done a lot for development of Andhra Pradesh. “It’s a necessity for AP people to give the power to Naidu again as he will play a key role in national politics and show a path of development to the entire country,” she added. Addressing a public meeting convened by TDP on Sunday, Mamata said Naidu is the leader to take the country forward. “Like he has done in Andhra Pradesh, Naidu can do a lot in Delhi,” she said. Coming down heavily on Modi, Mamata appealed the gathering to save the country and remove Modi (desh ko bachana hai to Modi ko hatao). “Modi claimed to be chaiwala after 2014 elections. Now he says he is chowkidar,” she added. “But chowkidar for whom? For those who looted the country. Modi had claimed that demonitisation would mitigate terrorism and stop black money, but ironically the number of terrorist attacks was the highest in the past two years. Under Modi’s regime, more number of farmers committed suicide and unemployment increased.” She added that Modi failed to explain the Pulawama incident and the Rafale deal and spurned the demand for an all-party meeting on the issues. “The nation does not want leaders like Narendra Modi and Amit Shah,” she asserted, and challenged Modi for an open debate on a national channel of his choice to discuss issues facing the country. UP: Juvenile held for raping 8-year-old.description: BAREILLY: A 17-year-old boy was arrested on Thursday for allegedly raping an eight-year-old girl in a village under jurisdiction of Nawabganj police station. The minor was raped on Wednesday, when she had gone out to fetch water from a nearby hand pump. The accused took the girl to a secluded place and raped her. Station house officer of Nawabganj, inspector Rajesh Kumar Singh, said, “The accused, who hails from a minority community, had been in correction home for raping a girl in 2017 and was released only seven months ago.” After producing him in court, he has again been sent to juvenile home on Friday. Superintendent of police (rural area) Sansar Singh said, “While going through CCTV footage, installed at a nearby college, we spotted a man in red shirt and black trousers taking the survivor on his bicycle. During investigation, we learnt that two juvenile were nabbed and sent to juvenile home in 2017 on charges of raping two girls of the same village.” Police said that they took the boys in custody and produced them before the girl. “Seeing her tormentor the girl was frightened but was able to identify him. Over brief interrogation, the accused confessed of raping the girl. Since the accused juvenile hails from minority community and rape survivor is from other community, chances were high that the matter would take communal turn. However, we have deployed adequate police force there and the situation is now completely under control,” SHO said. On Wednesday when the survivor was going to fetch water from a nearby hand pump, accused juvenile, who came on a bicycle, told the girl that her father was calling her but he took her to a secluded place where he allegedly raped her. The accused later dropped the girl near her home. The survivor narrated the ordeals to her mother in the evening. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

UP releases Rs 20 cr for uniforms of gov.description: Meerut: In what is being considered as a welcome move, a sum of Rs 20 crore has been released for purchasing school uniforms for UP government schoolchildren. However, the money has been released only for non BPL students as the funds for uniforms of BPL, SC and ST children comes under Sarva Shiksha Abhiyan and is released by the central government.Unlike previous years, when the money for the uniforms used to be released as late as August, when school was already five months into session, this year, the funds were released two months into the session. “The amount released will be deposited in the bank accounts of school management committees depending on the number of non BPL kids in each school as per records. The share per student is Rs 400 such that they will get two uniforms, costing Rs 200 each,” said Bhola Nath, finance controller, basic shiksha parishad, UP, in his order.The amount should be used in accordance with Sarva Shiksha Abhiyan norms for school uniforms. “The amount used for purchasing school uniforms and the progress of uniform distribution should be updated with the basic shiksha adhikaris and further the state authorities should be informed about the matter,” read Nath’s order.The amount has been released for both primary and upper primary schools for students of Class 1 to VIII. Instructions have also been given to ensure that the budget is used as soon as possible.Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

PM Modi.description: JEYPORE: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday said his government had taken measures to set up a 'chowkidar' in space and asked people to vote for a government that can take concrete decisions and not just raise slogans. Launching his campaign in eastern India with a rally in Jeypore area of Odisha's Koraput district, the prime minister said the NDA government wouldn't have been able to do any development work in the country without the support of the people. He sought blessings from his supporters for the 2019 Lok Sabha elections and asserted that the NDA government has left no stone unturned to bring about development in the state. Land, air or space, we had courage to do surgical strikes: PM Modi"The NDA government has been working hard to develop road and rail infrastructure in the state. There is no dearth of funds when it comes to development work in the country. "In the last five years, the government has been able to build homes for eight lakh families, light up 3,000 houses and provide gas connections to 40 lakh homes," Modi stated. Referring to Mission Shakti, when India demonstrated anti-satellite (ASAT) missile capability by shooting down a live satellite, he said the government has taken measures to set up a 'chowkidar' (watchman) in space. He came down heavily on opposition parties who he said "belittled" the space achievement. "Those that are criticising the anti-satellite technology will be given a befitting reply in the elections," he claimed, urging people to vote for a government that can take concrete decisions, not the one that only raises slogans. In Video:Govt has taken measures to set up 'chowkidar' in space: PM Narendra Modi in OdishaDownload The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Woman\u2019s semi-nude body, with head,.description: Meerut: In a shocking incident, body of a woman, in her early 30s, with head and one hand missing, was exhumed from a field in Lohia Nagar in Meerut’s Daurala area, approximately 400m from NH58 on Thursday. A local farmer, Ishwar Pandit, alerted the police after he felt a foul smell emanating from his field. When police reached the spot, it exhumed the decomposing body of a woman – her head and left hand both missing. They were apparently chopped off using a sharp weapon. A huge crowd gathered at the spot after the news of the sensational murder spread like wildfire in the area. Investigation in the case has begun. “Our priority is to ascertain the identity of the victim. We are in the process of alerting police stations in Meerut and neighbouring districts who can cross-check the missing person’s reports filed at their respective police stations,” SP (city) Akhilesh Narayan Singh said. “The body will be kept in the morgue for the next 72 hours before it is sent for post-mortem. Efforts are being made to ascertain her identity. Exact cause of her death will be known only after the autopsy,” an investigator in the case said. This comes almost a month after torso of a woman and her head were recovered at two separate places in Bulandshahr. Despite local police putting in efforts, the body has yet not been identified. Neighbour rapes minor, arrested.description: BIJNOR: A 22-year-old man was arrested in Bijnor and sent to jail on Saturday after his neighbor, a 16-year-old girl, accused him of raping her. According to the police, the incident took place on Friday evening. Accused Mohammad Sadiq barged into the room of the girl and raped her. The police said that after committing the crime Sadiq escaped. A case was registered against the accused under section 376 of IPC and POCSO Act on the late Friday night after which the accused was arrested the next morning. Bijnor superintendent of police Sanjeev Tyagi, said, “We have arrested Sadiq. He was at large since Friday evening.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Urmila Matondkar.description: MUMBAI: The Congress on Friday nominated actress Urmila Matondkar and former Lok Sabha speaker Meira Kumar from Mumbai North and Bihar's Sasaram parliamentary constituencies respectively. The party renominated its sitting MP Ranjet Ranjan from Supaul in Bihar, as it released a list of another 12 candidates for the general elections. With this list, the Congress has so far nominated 305 Lok Sabha candidates. Urmila Matondkar to contest from Mumbai North parliamentary constituency on a Congress ticket.… https://t.co/JweKWNh1FN— ANI (@ANI) 1553836382000It also changed its candidate in Uttar Pradesh's Maharajganj by now fielding Supriya Shrinate in place of Tanushree Tripathi, the daughter of jailed politician Amarmani Tripathi, after facing widespread criticism. "The Congress central election committee has approved the candidature of Urmila Matondkar as party candidate to contest the ensuing general elections from Mumbai North parliamentary constituency in Maharashtra," a party statement said. Matondkar had joined the Congress after meeting Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday and had later said that she was "here to stay". Meira Kumar have been contesting from her Sasaram parliamentary constituency for many years but had lost in the 2014 Lok Sabha polls. Apart from Supriya Shrinate, in the list of 12 candidates released by the party, four are from Bihar and seven from Odisha. The Congress also released a list of 20 candidates for Odisha Assembly election. 650 transformers \u2018blow off\u2019 th.description: BIJNOR: Around 25 transformers in western UP’s Bijnor district are ‘blowing off’ every day due to huge power overload this summer. And the constant malfunctioning of transformers is leading to massive power outages in the district causing much inconvenience to the people in this scorching heat. Power department officials claimed that on an average 10-12 transformers ‘blow off’ in other seasons. But, the count nearly doubled this summer with around 650 transformers stopped functioning between May 14 and June 14, the officials admitted. And as a result, with regular power cuts, the people – battling the severe heat wave - are living in hellish conditions. Some of the transformers have been badly damaged during the ongoing heat wave. It was 46 degrees Celsius recorded in Bijnor on Saturday. So, it is problem aplenty for Paschimanchal Vidyut Vitran Nigam Limited. According to sources, there is a provision that burnt transformers should be replaced within 24 hours in a city and 72 hours in rural areas. But here, the power corporation has failed to replace the transformers on time. Assistant engineer at a workshop, Susheel Kumar, said, “With rising temperature, cases of burning transformers have doubled. Earlier, under normal situation, around 10 to 12 transformers were burning out in a day while at present, the numbers have reached 22 to 25 per day. Most of the burning transformers are of ‘25KVA’.” Kumar also said, “In summer, both power consumption and load usually shoots up resulting in damaging the transformer. There are over 70,000 tubewells in the district which almost runs every day to irrigate the crop. Here, the main crop is sugarcane which requires more irrigation than others. Besides, AC, fans and coolers are used in excess. We are trying our best to replace the burnt transformers.” The transformers which ‘blow off’ also pose a threat to the people, particularly in populated areas. Arbaaz Khan, a resident of Sherkot, said, “Blowing off transformers is common for villagers in summer season. But, the situation is very bad this year. On Friday, a transformer in Halwaeyaan Mohalla of Sherkot suddenly caught fire. There was panic all around but luckily no one was hurt. Power corporation authorities should do regular inspections of the transformers - maintain it properly and check its load from time to time.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Unidentified vehicle hits bike, two dead.description: BIJNOR: Two people died on the spot after an unidentified vehicle hit their motorcycle on Meerut-Haridwar road near Bijnor’s Mandawar area late on Tuesday night. A case has been registered and police are trying to identify the owner of the vehicle. The two were on their way to Haridwar to take holy dip on the Ganga river. According to police, the victims have been identified as Rahul Kumar (29) and Yogendra Sharma (40), both residents of Bahrampur Morna in Meerut. The unidentified vehicle hit their motorcycle near Ratanpur village under Mandawar police station area of Bijnor district. When other commuters saw the bodies lying on the road, they informed police. On getting the information, cops rushed to the spot and sent the bodies to the district hospital for postmortem. Police claimed that the owner of the vehicle would be traced soon. Jaya Prada.description: HYDERABAD: It’s been a roller coaster ride for actress Jaya Prada in politics. The actress, who started off as a Telugu film heroine dominating the scene along with Sridevi some decades ago, changed her political course on Tuesday by joining the BJP. In the last 25 years of her political career, she has changed several parties. Hailing from Rajahmundry in Andhra Pradesh, she began her political career with the Telugu Desam Party in 1994 as she had done several films alongside TDP founderpresident N T Rama Rao. After N Chandrababu Naidu took over as chief minister, he nominated her to the Rajya Sabha and she served a term from 1996-2002. While in the TDP, Jaya Prada had a running feud with Renuka Chowdhary who was also in the TDP then. When it became clear that she was being ignored in the TDP, Jaya Prada looked for greener pastures elsewhere. The Samajwadi Party led by Mulayam Singh Yadav in Uttar Pradesh got Jaya Prada into its party fold. She contested the Rampur Lok Sabha seat from that state on the SP ticket and won in 2004. In the 2009 elections, she got re-elected from the same constituency. With differences sprouting between SP leader Amar Singh and Mulayam Singh Yadav, Jaya prada had to make a choice on who she would sail with. She preferred to join the new party that Amar Singh floated but that proved to be a futile exercise. Jaya Prada then joined the Rashtriya Janata Dal, led by Ajit Singh in UP, making the move along with Amar Singh. In the 2014 elections she was fielded as an LS candidate from Bijnor but lost. For some time, there was speculation that Jaya Prada would return to the Telugu Desam Party when she met Andhra Pradesh chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu in Amaravati in November 2015. It turned out that she had met Naidu only to invite him for her son Siddharth’s wedding that month in Hyderabad. In 2013, Jaya Prada had met Congress president Sonia Gandhi and that also led to speculation that she would join the Congress. She had even announced that she was interested in getting back to her home state and would continue her political career there. She was keen on returning to AP politics but nothing concrete materialised. On Tuesday, she was welcomed into the BJP at the party’s headquarters in Delhi. “I am working with a brave leader in whose hands India is safe,” she said about Modi. Four women among 11 booked, held for fra.description: MEERUT: Four women, including an alleged rape survivor, were among 11 booked and arrested for hatching a conspiracy to frame a Bulandshahr man in rape case. According to initial complaint, a minor girl was abducted by three men, and she was sedated and raped by Jitu, the prime accused. Investigation in the case, however, exposed the conspiracy with police claiming that the alleged raped survivor, her mother and aunt were hired by one Manish, who wanted to settle his scores with his rival Jitu by framing him in a rape case. According to Buladshahr superintendent of police (rural) Manish Kumar Mishra, the conspiracy was hatched at the Bulandshahr district prison, where Manish was lodged in an attempt to murder case on the complaint of Jitu. Manish was, however, released on a bail last month. In the prison, Manish met convicts Dabbu, Yogesh and Pawan and hired them to frame Jitu in a rape case. The trio later hired a woman and her daughter with the help of their acquaintance Prabha, who allegedly masterminded the plan outside jail, said the SP. The SP said police picked up several aberrations in the story concocted by the alleged rape survivor, who claimed that she was abducted and raped by Jitu on June 13. “We crosschecked statements of the girl with the details her call records. The time around the incident happened, she was continuously in touch with her mother and aunt,” said the SP. “As the investigation progressed, the medical tests confirmed that the girl was not a minor. Her mother later confessed that her daughter is a mother of a child. The gang broke down during investigation and confessed to have hatched a conspiracy to frame Jitu at the behest of Manish,” another investigator said. Meanwhile, registering a fresh case in this connection, police have booked 11 accused, including three convicts serving sentences, Manish, and the four women. Police have also arrested the alleged rape survivor, her mother, aunt and another woman as co-conspirators. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Journalist assaulted by cops: Two-member.description: MEERUT: Days after a Shamli-based journalist Amit Sharma was assaulted by cops at GRP station, a two-member team of Press Council of India (PCI) comprising Jai Shankar Gupta and Uttam Chand Sharma reached Shamli on Saturday morning. The team held a closed door meeting with local journalists at a city hotel. It also recorded the victim’s statement and of other journalists who were present at the spot when the incident took place. The team visited the local GRP station as well. This comes a day after NHRC issued a notice to UP DGP OP Singh calling for a detailed report in the matter, including action taken against the guilty public servants and status of the FIR registered against them. “Going by the reported allegations, this kind of cruel and uncivilised act by a public servant is highly disgraceful and cannot be tolerated in a civilised society,” the human rights body stated in a release. “Stern action should be taken against the police personnel if found guilty so that such a barbaric act is not repeated by any public servant in future,” the release added. A case against four police personnel, including SHO Rakesh Kumar under the IPC sections 323 (causing hurt), 504 (intentional insult), 506 (criminal intimidation), 364 (abduction), 392 (punishment for robbery) and 342 (wrongful confinement) has been lodged at GRP police station after the assault. Out of the four accused, SHO Kumar and another constable were suspended soon after the incident. It all began on Tuesday evening when GRP personnel entered into an argument with Sharma when the latter was covering the derailment of a goods train in Shamli. Several videos of the attack went viral after the incident in which SHO Kumar could be seen attacking Sharma near the derailment site at Dhimanpur area of the district. The victim also claimed he was stripped by cops and Kumar urinated in his mouth. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Pawan Kalyan.description: GUNTUR: Stating that they will bulldoze bastions of TDP and YSR Congress, Janasena president Pawan Kalyan promised to grant Rs 5,000 pension to all farmers in the state. He said they will also grant Rs 8,000 crop incentive to farmers soon after coming into power in the next elections. Pawan further said his government would provide six to 10 LPG cylinders free-of-cost to each family every year. and also promised to fill 3 lakh vacancies in the government departments to provide jobs to youth. Addressing a meeting in Guntur on Monday, Pawan said that the future of the state did not mean the future of Lokesh and Jagan but it was the future of the people. “The space on the state’s political stage is not TDP’s and YSRC’s property as youth and women are eager to bring change through Jana Sena.” “TDP had lost moral right to rule the state as chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu had no control over his legislators who indulged in illegal activities,” Pawan said adding that he jumped into the political arena to bring in a change in the lives of commoners. “We supported TDP and BJP in the last elections with a hope to transform the state. Unfortunately, both of them have shattered our dreams,” he said. “Guntur city has been left in a lurch despite located a few kilometres away from the capital city. The entire city has been dug out in the guise of laying underground drainage scheme and left without repair. How shocking it is to see 30 people dying of diarrhoea in a city like Guntur? Is it not the failure of the state government? Opposition leader Jaganmohan Reddy is equally responsible for the tragedy as he never dared to question the government by going to the assembly,” he said. He further said they would construct apartments exclusively for Muslims in the city. He appealed to people to support his candidates Chandrasekhar (Guntur West), Zia-Ur-Rehman (East) and MP candidate Bonaboina Srinivas Yadav in the elections, Pawan said they fielded a BC candidate Srinivasa Yadav whereas TDP and YSRC both have given tickets to their own communities. Muzaffarnagar mulls traditional use of d.description: MUZAFFARNAGAR: After hosting the first Gud Mahotsav in the country in Muzaffarnagar , plans are afoot to revive the traditional method of making gud (jaggery) by harnessing draft animals to power the crusher for extracting juice from cane. Using bulls to run the crusher to make jaggery will help in saving electricity, a major problem that kolhu (indigenous units that produce gud) owners face in the district. It was here that the proposal to go back to traditional method of making ‘green gud’ was mooted. Explaining district magistrate Ajay Shankar Pandey said, “The district has been chosen for the CM’s ‘one district, one production’ scheme. Therefore, we had organized a Gud Mahotsav some days ago. During the Gud Mahotsav, many issues were raised and suggestions from the kolhu owners were received for solving problems. We should revive the tradition kolhu. I have presented a concept note during the Gud Mahotsav in which the idea of harnessing animal power was presented. The jaggery manufactured by such kolhus can be promoted as green gud in the market. Adopting this method will reduce power consumption and also help solve the issue of stray cattle.” According to sources in the administration, the DM is going to hold a meeting with kolhu owners in the coming days to discuss the green gud concept. A report on it is also being prepared to be sent to the government. In sugarcane-rich Muzaffarnagar district, with crushing season over at the mills, around 800 kolhus are working overtime at villages, producing jaggery. The administration also hopes to introduce green gud as part of the midday meal for schoolchildren as well as use it for preparing food at various government functions. BJP Candidate List.description: NEW DELHI: Amid rumblings over ticket denials in some seats like Kanpur, where saffron veteran   Murli Manohar Joshi has been benched   , and Bangalore South, where the wife of late party leader Ananth Kumar was overlooked for a young debutant, BJP issued on Tuesday a list of 43 nominees for the Lok Sabha polls. Not budging in the face of Joshi’s stiff resistance to being asked to step aside, BJP announced Satyadev Pachauri, a minister in the UP cabinet, as the replacement for the octogenarian leader. The list of 30 candidates for UP, however, accommodated women and child welfare minister Maneka Gandhi and her son Varun Gandhi, who were allowed to swap their Pilibhit and Sultanpur seats. Other interesting picks include   actor-politician Jaya Prada   , who was named against SP leader Azam Khan from Rampur in UP soon after she joined BJP. The selection ignites an old and bitter rivalry, as the former Bollywood star is close to former SP leader Amar Singh who has scores to settle with SP and Khan. Another UP cabinet minister, Rita Bahuguna Joshi, a former UP Congress chief who joined BJP, will contest from the prestigious constituency of Allahabad, where the sitting party MP, Shyama Charab Gupta, has left for SP and is contesting from Banda. She is the daughter of the late H N Bahuguna, a former UP chief minister and well-known Congress leader. Law minister Ravi Shankar Prasad, the party’s candidate from Patna Sahib, faced protests when he landed in Patna on Tuesday. The protesters claimed loyalty to BJP’s Rajya Sabha MP R K Sinha, who was later pulled up by the party while sources said the heckling was led by a person identified as an expelled BJP member. Varun Gandhi, who has had his ups and downs in BJP, was on the list of nominees and will stake his claim for Pilibhit, which has been a family bastion. Maneka Gandhi will be pitted in a triangular contest against SP-BSP alliance candidate Chandrabhanu Singh, alias Sonu Singh, a local politician with clout among Rajput voters who could have turned up the heat for Varun. Rajya Sabha MP Sanjay Singh is in the fray as the Congress nominee. Joshi, a former BJP president, made no secret of his displeasure at being denied a ticket and went public by releasing a letter addressed to voters of Kanpur saying he received a call from party general secretary (organisation) Ramlal asking him not to contest the polls. Joshi, 85, has been asked not to contest just as it was decided that 91-year-old party patriarch L K Advani will not fight from Gandhinagar. Joshi’s defiant note was possibly the reason behind the nomination of a Brahmin face as another UP state minister, Satish Mahana, had been talked of as the frontrunner to replace the veteran leader The party decision is in line with several veterans not being nominated to pave way for younger leaders. The 2019 election will see the curtain drop on the electoral politics of what was seen the Vajpayee-Advani era in the party. BJP has also not given tickets to B C Khanduri, Karia Munda, Kalraj Mishra, Bijoya Chakravarty — all MPs for several terms and over 80 years of age. BJP sprang a surprise by giving 28-year-old Tejaswi Surya, an advocate and Karnataka Bharatiya Janata Yuva Morcha general secretary, the ticket from Bangalore South, belying expectations that Tejaswini Ananth Kumar would be its choice for the constituency her husband represented six times. The choice triggered strong protests and even state BJP president B S Yeddyurappa said they had sent only Tejaswini’s name, which, he claimed, was changed in Delhi. Tejaswini had to issue statements to mollify her supporters as she said the polls were about re-electing Narendra Modi as Prime Minister. BJP has announced 349 candidates, including 62 in UP, so far. Two seats in UP have been left for alliance partner Apna Dal (Sonelal). Party president Amit Shah will decide the remaining 16 seats in UP where sitting MPs are likely to be replaced, and a reason behind delaying the announcement is to reduce prospects of dissidence and rebellion. The party has so far dropped 14 sitting MPs in UP. BJP general secretary Arun Singh announced that Union minister Manoj Sinha has been fielded from Ghazipur, a seat he had won in 2014. BJP’s Kisan Morcha chief Birendra Singh Mast has been shifted from his sitting seat Bhadohi to far-east Ballia in UP, replacing sitting MP Bharat Singh, whose poor performance was a concern for the party. Agra MP Ram Shankar Katheria, head of the SC commission who had been denied renomination from the current seat, has been moved to Etawah (SC), replacing Ashok Kumar Dohray. UP BJP president Mahendra Nath Pandey has been repeated from Chandauli. In Video:No Murli Manohar Joshi in BJP list of 43Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

1 tonne polythene seized in drive agains.description: BIJNOR: One year after Uttar Pradesh banned the use and manufacturing of plastic and polythene under 50 micron, a drive against polythene led to the seizure of 1000 kilogram of polythene on Friday. The plastic was seized and taken in five tractor trolleys from the spot after a drive was conducted at shops in the city market on Friday. The drive was headed by Bijnor sub-divisional magistrate Brajesh Kumar Singh. Raids were conducted here at the main market, Sabji Mandi and Ghantaghar area. According to Singh, we have launched a drive against the use of polythene and plastic bags in district. On Friday, a large amount of polythene and plastic bags were seized from four godowns and several shops in Bijnor city. “We have slapped a fine of Rs 15,000 and served notices to the erring shopkeepers and godown owners in connection with selling and using polythene. The drive is on,” Singh further stated. Besides, a joint team of administration and municipal authorities have spread awareness among people regarding the dangers of using plastic bags and polythene. There was panic in the city especially among the shop keepers after the raid. According to the ordinance, plastic and other non-biodegradable waste (use and disposal ordinance-2018), vetted by UP governor Ram Naik, the use and manufacture of polythene less than 50 micron invites a penalty ranging from Rs 100 to Rs 1 lakh and imprisonment of up to six months. Woman cricket coach booked for thrashing.description: Muzaffarnagar: A case has been registered against a cricket coach, Priti Mehra, posted in the district's stadium here for allegedly thrashing an 18-year-old girl training under her.In their complaint with police, the girl’s family alleged that coach Priti Mehra thrashed Iqra Naaz on Thursday. The girl in question showed bruise marks as a result of the beating with a stick by the coach. It was alleged that the coach has thrashed other girls too. Police are probing the matter and coach Mehra has been booked.After the incident, Naaz’s staged a protest outside the DM office and filed a complaint at the Civil Line police station.According to station house officer of Civil Line police station Navratan Goutam, “A case under IPC sections 323 (punishment for voluntarily causing hurt.), 504 (intentional insult with intent to provoke breach of the peace.) and 506 (punishment for criminal intimidation) has been registered against accused and investigation is on. Action will be taken accordingly.”Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Nagpur BJP Candidate List.description: NAGPUR: After deadline for withdrawal for the first phase of Lok Sabha polls, 31 out of 147 candidates, whose nomination papers were found valid in seven constituencies of Vidarbha, have withdrew their papers. Now, 116 candidates are in the election fray, according chief electoral officer. Those remaining in the fray across seven constituencies are — Wardha – 14, Ramtek – 16, Nagpur – 30, Bhandara-Gondia – 14, Chandrapur – 13, Yavatmal-Washim – 24 and Gadchiroli-Chimur – 5. BJP leaders in Bhandara-Gondia are heaving a sigh of relief as two of the four rebels, Khushal Bopche and Prakash Malgave, have withdrawn from the fray after hours of persuasion by them. However, Rajendra Patle is still in the fray. Virendra Jaiswal, who resigned from BJP before nominations, is not being considered rebel as he contests every time. BJP’s Sunil Mendhe is pitted against Nana Panchbudhe of NCP here. Bopche’s rebellion had created panic in the BJP camp as he is popular in the Pawar community and in general among OBCs. In Nagpur, Abdul Karim Patel and Ravikant Meshram, withdrew on Thursday, taking the total number to three. Pallavi Nandeshwar had withdrawn on Wednesday. In Ramtek, Sachin Shende, Gajanan Jambhulkar, Prakash Tembhurne, Ranjit Saphelkar and Lalit Shamkuwar have opted out of the race. In Yavatmal-Washim and Wardha, seven and two candidates respectively withdrew on the final day. One independent candidate withdrew his nomination in Gadchiroli-Chimur constituency on Thursday. (With inputs from TO Abraham & Balwant Dhage) Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Meerut: 4 held for Rs 50 lakh theft.description: MEERUT: Police have arrested four persons from Saharanpur on Tuesday for allegedly stealing Rs 50 lakh from a shop in Mahant market recently. Sources said that Rs 42 lakh was recovered from the accused. The accused were identified Pankaj singh, Vishal Kumar, Sachin Kumar and Sandeep Singh, all residents of Saharanpur. Their aide Banshi Lal is on the run. According to police, Rs 50 lakh was stolen from the shop of a trader, Himanshu Chawla, in Mahant market on May 22 night. Based on a tip-off, police raided the hideout of the accused and arrested them. Later, money stashed at different locations were also recovered, they added. Meerut ADG Prashant Kumar said, “90% of the stolen cash has been recovered. We are working on recovering the remaining amount.” Saharanpur SSP Dinesh Kumar P said that the gang members distributed the money among themselves before going into hiding. Police also said that the same gang has confessed to a theft of Rs 7.5 lakh in the same market in 2016. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Satta King 2019.description: NEW DELHI: Satta Matka is a form of gambling or lottery that had originated before the Independence of India.Originally, the game of Matka gambling involved betting on the opening and closing rates of cotton as transmitted to the Bombay Cotton Exchange from the New York Cotton Exchange, via teleprinters.The modern-day Matka gambling/ Satta King is based on random number selection and betting. The players participating in the Satta Matka game/ gambling are required to choose the right number for winning the game. The player who wins the game becomes Satta King and is rewarded financially. Two of the most famous Matka games are - Kalyan and Worli. The Kalyan Matka gambling was started by Kalyanji Bhagat, a farmer from Gujarat, in 1962 and it ran for all days of the week. Another Matka gambling, New Worli Matka, was started by the Rattan Khatri in 1964 with slight modifications to the rules of the game. Khatri’s Matka ran only five days a week, from Monday to Friday.The modern Matka business is centred around Maharashtra.Some of the terms used in the game and their meaning is given below:    Term Meaning   Matka Matka means earthen pot that were used to draw numbers   Single Any digit between 0 and 9   Jodi/Pair Any pair of two digits between 00 and 99    Patti/Panna Three digit number    Open result / close result Outcome of matka betting   Berij Berij is last digit of jodi's/pair's sum The Google 2018 trends data shows that 'satta' and 'matka' were the top searched words in the Madhya Pradesh state in the year 2018. As per the Google data, 'satta' was the 4th most searched word with a score of 36 and 'matka' came 6th with a score of 23.Any form of Satta Matka gambling is illegal in India.Disclaimer: This content is for reference purpose only and The Times of India claims no ownership of this content. 15-year-old girl kidnapped, gang-raped i.description: MEERUT: A 15-year-old girl was kidnapped from her house and gang-raped by two men in a nearby field in Shamli district recently. According to sources, the girl was at her home late on Sunday evening when two men belonging to a minority community kidnapped her. They then took her to a nearby field and gang-raped her. The crime came to light on Monday morning when a farmer spotted her lying unconscious in the field. Sources added that he alerted the family and police who rushed to the spot. Based on a complaint, police have registered a case against two persons – Sohail and Soman – under the relevant sections of IPC and POCSO Act. Later, the girl was sent to the district hospital for medical examination. Kandhla station house officer SK Vishnoi said, “The accused, identified as Soman and Sohail, are both residents of the same village. We have started an investigation into the matter and are on the lookout for the accused.” As news about the rape spread, tension prevailed in the village. Later, police personnel were deployed in the area to avoid any untoward incidents. Shamli additional superintendent of police Rajesh Kumar said, “We have formed two police teams to arrest the accused. Also, police teams have been deployed in the village to monitor the situation.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

One dies, another hurt in accident.description: Meerut: A 35-year-old truck helper died at the spot and the driver was seriously injured after a speeding container rammed into a stationary truck on Eastern Peripheral Expressway early on Friday morning. The deceased got trapped inside the container which got crushed and was later taken out after cutting the truck. Shiv Prakash Singh, station house officer, Baghpat police station, said, “The incident took place at 4 am on Friday morning when a speeding container rammed into a stationary truck. Some villagers rushed to the spot and informed the police. The driver and the helper got trapped in the container and were taken out after cutting the container with gas cutters.” The two victims were rushed to the spot. While the helper was declared brought dead, the driving is battling for his life. In May end, this year, four students of Greater Noida’s Sharda University died and a girl was critically injured after the car they were traveling in rammed a stationary truck on the deadly Eastern Peripheral Expressway near Baghpat. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Two minor girls raped in Bijnor.description: Bijnor: Two minors aged seven and eight years old were allegedly raped at two different places under Barhapur police station area here. Police have arrested a suspect and registered two cases.The first case was reported from a village under the jurisdiction of Nagina police station. The mother of the minor survivor lodged a complaint with police on Thursday, alleging that her daughter was raped by a relative at Sikkawala village under Barhapur police station area on Tuesday. The girl had gone there along with her father to attend a wedding. The accused allegedly picked her up, took her to a field and raped her, her mother claimed. The family learnt about the crime on June 12 when the girl returned home. The family suspected something was amiss as the girl was frightened and nervous. When asked, narrated her ordeal to them. Police have registered a case against the alleged culprit under IPC section 376 (rape) and provisions of the POCSO Act. He has been arrested.Another minor was allegedly ‘raped’ in a village under the jurisdiction of Barhapur police station on the intervening night of Wednesday and Thursday. Her family members claimed that a 22-year-old neighbour abducted the eight-year-old while she was asleep in her house and took her to a field and raped her. The girl’s family members filed a complaint on Thursday at Barhapur police station. Police have registered a case. The accused is on the run as of now. Police have claimed that it was an attempt to rape.Addressing a press conference, city superintendent of police Lakhsmi Niwas Mishra said, “The crimes were committed at separate villages under Barhapur police station area. Police have registered a case against the accused under 376 of IPC and POCSO Act. The girls were sent to the district hospital for medical examination and treatment.”Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BJP List 2019 Maharashtra.description: AURANGABAD/KOLHAPUR: Sitting MPs Sunil Gaikwad (Latur) and Dilip Gandhi (Ahmednagar) were denied tickets for the forthcoming Lok Sabha elections in the BJP’s first national list of candidates announced on Thursday. The list included 16 names from Maharashtra. While speculations were rife that the party would not retain Gaikwad owing to his differences with some senior BJP leaders, what came as a surprise was the ticket going to Sudhakar Shrungare, a member of the Latur zilla parishad. However, Shrungare, who is in the construction business, was the popular choice of local BJP workers. Gaikwad had won the 2014 election by a majority of over 2.5 lakh votes. Considered to be close to Union minister Nitin Gadkari, he was reportedly at loggerheads with Latur district guardian minister Sambhaji Patil-Nilangekar. The nomination of Sujay Vikhe Patil, son of senior Congress leader Radhakrishna Vikhe Patil, from Ahmednagar instead of Gandhi was a foregone conclusion ever since he joined the party last week. Sujay, a neurosurgeon by profession, will be making his entry into politics with this nomination. His late grandfather, Balasaheb Vikhe Patil, was long associated with the Congress. | Full coverage of Lok Sabha elections in MaharashtraAmong other prominent leaders from Maharashtra in the first list of candidates are Union minister Nitin Gadkari from his hometown Nagpur, state BJP chief Raosaheb Danve from Jalna, Union MoS Hansraj Ahir from Chandrapur and Union MoS for defence Subash Bhamre from Dhule. Late BJP MP Gopinath Munde’s daughter, Pritam, who was elected to Parliament with a record majority after her father’s death, has been renominated from Beed. Sitting MP from Sangli Sanjay Patil has also been renominated, putting an end to speculation over any change in constituency. Patil’s candidature was opposed by a section of BJP leaders in Sangli. However, chief minister Devendra Fadnavis is understood to have called a meeting of local party leaders and resolved the differences. The party has also given tickets to Heena Gavit from Nandurbar, Raksha Khadse from Raver, Poonam Mahajan from Mumbai North Central, Kapil Patil from Bhiwandi, Sanjay Dhotre from Akola, Ramdas Tadas from Wardha, Ashok Nete from Gadchiroli and Gopal Shetty from Mumbai North.
